author: Special Correspondent
text:
The ruling AIADMK has a slight edge over the DMK, according to a pre-poll survey by Puthiya Thalaimurai, a private satellite channel.

The survey conducted in 200 places with 5,018 voters has given the AIADMK 34.48 per cent votes when it comes to providing good governance. The DMK has scored 33.33 per cent. Surprisingly, the survey, conducted between January 22 and February 6 in five zones, contends that 33.13 per cent people will vote for the AIADMK and 32.83 per cent people for the DMK.

A total of 24.09 per cent voters felt that Tamil Nadu will be safe in the hands of Chief Minister Jayalalithaa. DMK treasurer M.K. Stalin comes next with 12.90 per cent votes. He is followed by DMK leader M. Karunanidhi with 12.67 per cent.

Desiya Murpokku Dravida Kazhagam (DMDK) leader Vijayakant has polled just 3.85 per cent votes.

Ms. Jayalalithaa also tops a list asking people to choose their next Chief Minister candidate with 32.63 per cent votes. Mr. Stalin and Mr. Karunanidi scored 18.88 and 15.21 per cent votes respectively.

Mr. Vijayakant polled 6.54 per cent votes and PMK’s Chief Ministerial candidate Anbumani Ramadoss, 4.30 per cent.
title: AIADMK has slight edge over DMK: survey
